commands.help¶

Classes¶

Help

This class provides help functionality by offering detailed descriptions for each command.

Module Contents¶

class commands.help.Help[source]¶

This class provides help functionality by offering detailed descriptions for each command.

Why: Ideal for users unfamiliar with commands, allowing them to quickly access help details on all available commands in the application, streamlining the learning curve and improving usability.

How: Common usage examples: 1. Help.help_all(): Generate help payload with descriptions of all commands. 2. Help.help(command_name): Generate a help description payload for a specific command.

commands_dictionary[source]¶
command_help[source]¶
payload[source]¶
help_all()[source]¶

Generates a payload with help details for all commands.

Returns:

A payload object containing helper details for all commands.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

Why: Provides an easily accessible, full list of command descriptions for users needing an overview or guidance on available functionalities. How: Example usage - ` all_help = help_obj.help_all() `

help(command_name)[source]¶

Generates a help description payload for a specific command.

Parameters:

command_name (str) – Name of the command to retrieve help for.

Returns:

A list of blocks containing details of the specified command.

Return type:

list

Why: Allows users to access help for a specific command without needing the full list, making it easier to find targeted information. How: Example usage - ` specific_help = help_obj.help("createtask") `
